name: umbel
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a cluster (= group) of small flowers on short spreading stems that come from the same point and form a shape similar to an open umbrella: in umbels The flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in large rounded umbels. The elder tree blossoms with huge umbels of starry white flowers.
a type of plant with hollow stems and flowers that grow in umbels: Common umbels with edible roots include carrots, celery, celery root (celeriac), and parsley. the umbel family
More examplesFewer examplesThe flowers are white or pink, borne in dense, rather flat-topped umbels.This is a tall cow-parsley, with broad umbels of pure white borne above green ferny foliage.Plants of the parsley and parsnip family are now in full bloom, nodding in the wind with their flowering heads known as umbels, hence their family name, the umbelliferae.If you know your umbels (remember poisonous hemlock is in this family) you can get a pretty good meal out of their roots.
